sentence: A study of analyst recommendations at the major brokerages shows that Procter & Gamble Co ( PG ) is the #11 broker pick, on average, out of the 30 stocks making up the Dow Jones Industrial Average , according to ETF Channel .
Procter & Gamble also comes in above the median of analyst picks among the broader S&P 500 Index components, claiming the #212 spot out of 500.

The Top 15 Broker Darlings of the Dow: Current Top Analyst Picks »

From the other direction, when companies have a low rank among analysts, it isn't necessarily the case that investors should conclude that the stock will perform poorly.

• 9 Stocks That Have No More Profits Left for You

It can, of course, but a bullish investor could also take the contrarian angle and read into the data that there is lots of room for upside because the stock is so out of favor.

For these reasons, we at ETF Channel find value to putting together these rankings, because both the top and the bottom ends of the lists can often make for some interesting stock picking ideas for further research.
